snippet: At least 16 people were killed near Kashgar, a part of the Xinjiang region beset with tensions between Muslim Uighurs and the government authorities.
abstract: Two police officers and 14 rioters are killed in Xinjiang, China, ethnically tense region in the country's far west, when the police clash with attackers who use explosives and knives; attack appears to be the latest spasm of ethnic violence in the region, which has been plagued by tensions between Muslim Uighurs and the government authorities.
lead_paragraph: At least 16 people were killed near Kashgar, a part of the Xinjiang region beset with tensions between Muslim Uighurs and the government authorities.

headline.main: Police and ‘Rioters’ in Fatal Clash in Western China
headline.print_headline: China: Deadly Clash Erupts in Far West
